text: The 100 metres at the 1934 Women's World Games was held at the White City Stadium in London, from 9 to 11 August 1934. In the final, the German Käthe Krauß won the event in 11.9 seconds ahead of Polish Stella Walasiewicz and British Eileen Hiscock. ==Entrants== On 9 August an incomple list was published of participating athletes. This list consisted of athletes from seven nations: Austria, Czechslovakia, Great Britain, Germany, Italy, the Netherlands, Poland. Listed below are the athletes from these nations who were entered for the 100 metres event. A day later it was later also mentioned a team of 4 American sprinter was in London for the 100 metres event and 4x 100 metres event. Nationality Name * Note that there are some discrepancies with those names and the names listed in newspapers during the competition. * The Dutch Tollien Schuurman injured herself after winning her semi-final 60 metres event. She was replaced and the Dutch Cor Aalten and Beb Martin competed in the 100 metres event. ==Results== ===Heats=== The heats took place on 9 August. The Dutch Cor Aalten was eliminated in the heats. ====Heat 1==== Rank Name Nationality Time Notes 1 Doris Morgan 12.8" Q 2 Doppler Q 3 4 5 6 ====Heat 2==== Rank Name Nationality Time Notes 1 Audrey Dearnley 12.7" Q 2 Barbara Burke Q 3 4 5 6 ====Heat 3==== Rank Name Nationality Time Notes 1 Marie Dollinger 12.2" Q 2 Elsie Maguire Q 3 4 5 6 ====Heat 4==== Rank Name Nationality Time Notes 1 Käthe Krauß 12.2" Q 2 Johanna Vancura Q 3 4 5 6 ====Heat 5==== Rank Name Nationality Time Notes 1 Eileen Hiscock 12.2" Q 2 Anna Krausová Q 3 4 5 6 ====Heat 6==== Rank Name Nationality Time Notes 1 Stella Walasiewicz 12.2" Q 2 Beb Martin Q 3 4 5 6 Sources: ===Semi-finals=== The heats took place on 11 August. The Dutch Beb Martin finished 5th in her semi-final with a time of 12.6 seconds. ====Semi-final 1==== Rank Name Nationality Time Notes 1 Stella Walasiewicz 12.2" Q 2 Marie Dollinger Q 3 Barbara Burke Q 4 5 6 ====Semi-final 2==== Rank Name Nationality Time Notes 1 Käthe Krauß 12" Q 2 Eileen Hiscock Q 3 Audrey Dearnley Q 4 5 6 Source: ===Final=== The final took place on 12 August 1934. Rank Name Nationality Time Notes Käthe Krauß 11.9 Stella Walasiewicz 11.9 Eileen Hiscock 12.1e 4 Marie Dollinger 5 Audrey Dearnley 6 Barbara Burke Sources: ==References== Category:Athletics at the 1934 Women's World Games
title: Athletics at the 1934 Women's World Games – 100 metres
